intro: Selinocarpus palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's selinocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley, carrots, and celery, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It has finely divided, feathery leaves that are aromatic and may have medicinal properties. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain wildlife species.
